edu.rit.m2mp.packet
Class IncomingPacket

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.rit.m2mp.packet.Packet
        |
        +--edu.rit.m2mp.packet.IncomingPacket
public class IncomingPacket
extends Packet

Class IncomingPacket encapsulates an incoming packet in the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP).

To receive a packet:

  1. Call PacketPool.allocateIncomingPacket() to get an incoming packet object.
  2. Fill in the packet’s byte buffer; either —
    1. Call getBuffer() and pass the packet’s byte buffer to the underlying network layer to be filled in. Call setBufferLength() specifying the number of bytes the network layer filled in.
      — or —
    2. Call copy() to make a copy of an existing packet.
  3. Call verifyChecksum().
  4. Call getMessageID().
  5. Call getFragmentNumber().
  6. Call reset().
  7. Call read() to read the message contents. Call getAvailable() to check how many bytes are still available to be read.
  8. Call isLastPacket() to check if this packet contains the last fragment of a message.
  9. When done using the packet, call PacketPool.release().

Warning: Class IncomingPacket is not multiple thread safe.

M2MP Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Method Detail

setBufferLength

public void setBufferLength(int theLength)
Set the length of this incoming packet. Typically, the length comes from the underlying network layer.

Parameters:
theLength - Number of valid bytes in this packet’s byte buffer.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theLength is not in the range 11 .. 508, the range of valid lengths for an M2MP packet.

verifyChecksum

public boolean verifyChecksum()
Verifies whether this packet’s checksum field is correct.

Returns:
True if this packet’s checksum field is correct, false otherwise.

read

public int read()
Reads a byte from this packet. Assumes this packet has at least one unread byte.

Returns:
Byte that was read, an integer in the range 0x00 .. 0xFF.

read

public void read(byte[] b,
                 int off,
                 int len)
Reads a portion of a byte array from this packet. Assumes this packet has at least len unread bytes.

Parameters:
b - Byte array in which to place the bytes read.
off - Index of first byte placed in b.
len - Number of bytes to read.

skip

public void skip(int len)
Skips over a number of bytes in this packet. Assumes this packet has at least len unread bytes.

Parameters:
len - Number of bytes to skip.

getStartOffset

public int getStartOffset()
Returns the index within this packet’s buffer of the first message byte.

getFinishOffset

public int getFinishOffset()
Returns the index within this packet’s buffer of the last message byte.
